Description: Shoulder and body fragment of perhaps Aeolian pottery oenochoe; inside reserved; outside glazed black; on the shoulder, incised tongues, with added white on the first and the fifth; below, white and red bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd is published in Venit and Möller as being Vroulian, but it is not.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 48, no. 168 pl. 40)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 257)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.59)
